coreservlets.function

Class FunctionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • coreservlets.function.FunctionUtils

  • public class FunctionUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Some methods to illustrate use of the default or static methods (i.e., the non-abstract) methods of Function, Predicate, etc.

    From the coreservlets.com tutorials on JSF 2, PrimeFaces, Ajax, JavaScript, jQuery, GWT, Android, Spring, Hibernate, JPA, RESTful Web Services, Hadoop, Spring MVC, servlets, JSP, Java 8 lambdas and streams (for those that know Java already), and Java 8 programming (for those new to Java).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      FunctionUtils()

      static <T> java.util.List<T> allMatches(java.util.List<T> candidates, java.util.function.Predicate<T> matchFunction)
      Returns a List of all entries from input list that pass the match function.
      static <T> java.util.List<T> allMatches2(java.util.List<T> candidates, java.util.function.Predicate<T>... matchFunctions)
      Returns a List of all entries from input list that pass ALL the match functions.
      static <T> java.util.function.Predicate<T> combinedPredicate(java.util.function.Predicate<T>... tests)
      Returns a Predicate that is the result of ANDing all the argument Predicates.
      static <T> java.util.function.Function<T,T> composeAll(java.util.function.Function<T,T>... functions)
      Returns composition of given functions.

      Returns first entry from list that passes the match function.

      Calls the function on each element of the List.

      Returns a List with the given function applied to each element.

      Returns a List with the given functions applied.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FunctionUtils

        public FunctionUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • firstMatch

        public static <T> T firstMatch(java.util.List<T> candidates,
                               java.util.function.Predicate<T> matchFunction)
        Returns first entry from list that passes the match function. This is a generalized version of EmployeeUtils.firstMatchingEmployee.

      • allMatches

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> allMatches(java.util.List<T> candidates,
                                               java.util.function.Predicate<T> matchFunction)
        Returns a List of all entries from input list that pass the match function. The result could be an empty List, but not null. This is very similar to the builtin "filter" method of Stream.

      • combinedPredicate

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> java.util.function.Predicate<T> combinedPredicate(java.util.function.Predicate<T>... tests)
        Returns a Predicate that is the result of ANDing all the argument Predicates. If no Predicates are supplied, it returns a Predicate that always returns true. This method and allMatches2 are given here without much explanation, but are discussed in detail in the section on File I/O.

      • allMatches2

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> java.util.List<T> allMatches2(java.util.List<T> candidates,
                                                              java.util.function.Predicate<T>... matchFunctions)
        Returns a List of all entries from input list that pass ALL the match functions.

      • transform

        public static <T,R> java.util.List<R> transform(java.util.List<T> origValues,
                                                java.util.function.Function<T,R> transformer)
        Returns a List with the given function applied to each element. Very similar to the built-in "map" method of Streams.

      • transform2

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> java.util.List<T> transform2(java.util.List<T> origValues,
                                                             java.util.function.Function<T,T>... transformers)
        Returns a List with the given functions applied. The functions must all map their argument to an output of the SAME type (i.e., Function<T,T>).

      • composeAll

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> java.util.function.Function<T,T> composeAll(java.util.function.Function<T,T>... functions)
        Returns composition of given functions. Given 0 or more functions, returns a new function that is a composition of them, in order. The functions must all map their argument to an output of the SAME type (i.e., Function<T,T>).

      • processEntries

        public static <T> void processEntries(java.util.List<T> entries,
                                      java.util.function.Consumer<T> operation)
        Calls the function on each element of the List. Like the builtin forEach method of Stream and of List, which we have not yet covered. Used to illustrate the andThen method of Consumer.
